SEARCH
Module clientCLI
Package com.etiennecollin.ift2255.clientCLI

Class Utils

java.lang.Object
com.etiennecollin.ift2255.clientCLI.Utils
public class Utils extends Object
The `Utils` class provides utility methods for common tasks in the client command-line interface (CLI). It includes methods for handling user input, formatting strings, and creating menus.

  • Nested Class Summary

    static final record 
    Utils.DynamicMenuItem
    A record representing a dynamic menu item with a name, action, and display condition.

    • prettyPrompt

      public static String prettyPrompt(String prompt, Function<String,OperationResult> validator)
      Displays a prompt with single question and returns the user answer if valid.
      Parameters:
      prompt - The message to display as the prompt.
      validator - A Function that takes a String as input and returns a ValidationResult.
      Returns:
      The answer of the user.

    • prettify

      public static String prettify(String string)
      Prettifies a string by adding a delimiter bar at the beginning.
      Parameters:
      string - The input string to prettify.
      Returns:
      The prettified string with a delimiter at the beginning.

    • prettyPromptInt

      public static int prettyPromptInt(String prompt)
      Displays a formatted prompt to the console and retrieves an integer input from the user. Continues prompting the user until a valid integer is provided.
      Parameters:
      prompt - The prompt message to be displayed.
      Returns:
      A valid integer entered by the user.

    • prettyPromptInt

      public static int prettyPromptInt(String prompt, Function<Integer,OperationResult> validator)
      Displays a formatted prompt to the console and retrieves an integer input from the user. Continues prompting the user until a valid integer is provided.
      Parameters:
      prompt - The prompt message to be displayed.
      validator - A Function that takes an Integer as input and returns a ValidationResult
      Returns:
      A valid integer entered by the user.

    • prettyPromptBool

      public static boolean prettyPromptBool(String prompt)
      Displays a prompt to the user and expects a yes/no response. It keeps prompting until a valid response is given.
      Parameters:
      prompt - The message to display as the prompt.
      Returns:
      `true` if the user answers "yes/y/true/1" (case-insensitive), `false` if the user answers "no/n/false/0" (case-insensitive).

    • prettyPromptCurrency

      public static int prettyPromptCurrency(String prompt)
      Displays a formatted prompt to the console and retrieves a currency amount input from the user. The input is expected to be in the format of a number representing a currency value (e.g. for $10.00: "10", "$10", "10.", "10.00", and "$10.00" are valid). Continues prompting the user until a valid currency amount is provided.
      Parameters:
      prompt - The prompt message to be displayed.
      Returns:
      A valid currency amount in cents.
      Throws:
      NumberFormatException - If the input provided is not a valid number.

    • prettyPromptDate

      public static LocalDate prettyPromptDate(String prompt)
      Displays a formatted prompt to the console and retrieves a date input from the user. Continues prompting the user until a valid date is provided.
      Parameters:
      prompt - The prompt message to be displayed.
      Returns:
      A valid LocalDate entered by the user.

    • prettyMenu

      public static int prettyMenu(String prompt, String[] choices)
      Displays a menu with choices to the user and expects a numeric selection. It keeps prompting until a valid selection is made.
      Parameters:
      prompt - The message to display as the prompt.
      choices - An array of strings representing the menu choices.
      Returns:
      The index of the selected choice (0-based index).

    • prettyMenu

      public static int prettyMenu(String prompt, ArrayList<String> choices)
      Displays a menu with choices to the user and expects a numeric selection. It keeps prompting until a valid selection is made.
      Parameters:
      prompt - The message to display as the prompt.
      choices - An array of strings representing the menu choices.
      Returns:
      The index of the selected choice (0-based index).

    • prettyMenuT

      protected static <T> T prettyMenuT(String prompt, ArrayList<T> choices)
      Displays a menu with choices to the user and expects a numeric selection. It keeps prompting until a valid selection is made.
      Type Parameters:
      T - The type of elements in the menu.
      Parameters:
      prompt - The message to display as the prompt.
      choices - An ArrayList of elements representing the menu choices.
      Returns:
      The selected element from the menu based on the numeric input.

    • prettyMenu

      public static <T extends Enum<T>> T prettyMenu(String prompt, Class<T> enumClass)
      Displays a formatted menu for selecting an option from an Enum, given a prompt. The user is prompted to choose from the available Enum constants.
      Type Parameters:
      T - The Enum type.
      Parameters:
      prompt - The message prompting the user for input.
      enumClass - The Class object representing the Enum type.
      Returns:
      The selected Enum constant.

    • prettyMenu

      protected static int prettyMenu(String prompt, ArrayList<ArrayList<String>> choices, String prefix)
      Displays a menu with choices to the user and expects a numeric selection. It keeps prompting until a valid selection is made.
      Parameters:
      prompt - The message to display as the prompt.
      choices - An ArrayList of ArrayLists of strings representing the menu choices.
      prefix - What each ArrayList contained in the main one represents. This prefix will be printed with an index.
      Returns:
      The index associated with the selected choice in choices.

    • prettyDynamicMenu

      public static void prettyDynamicMenu(String prompt, String backName, ArrayList<Utils.DynamicMenuItem> menuItems, Runnable topOfLoopDisplayer)
      Displays a dynamic menu with choices to the user and expects a numeric selection. It keeps prompting until a valid selection is made.
      Parameters:
      prompt - The message to display as the prompt.
      backName - The name associated with the "go back" option.
      menuItems - An ArrayList of DynamicMenuItems representing the menu choices.
      topOfLoopDisplayer - A Runnable providing functionality to be displayed at the top of the menu loop.

    • clearConsole

      public static void clearConsole()
      Clears the console screen by printing empty lines.

    • prettyPaginationMenu

      public static <T> void prettyPaginationMenu(List<T> items, int itemsPerPage, String actionName, Consumer<T> itemDisplayer, Function<T,String> itemMenuName, Function<T,Boolean> action, Function<T,T> itemUpdater)
      Displays a paginated menu for a list of items, allowing the user to perform actions on the items.
      Type Parameters:
      T - The type of elements in the menu.
      Parameters:
      items - The list of items to be displayed in the menu.
      itemsPerPage - The number of items to display per page.
      actionName - The name of the action to perform on selected items.
      itemDisplayer - A Consumer that displays an individual item.
      itemMenuName - A Function that returns a string representing the menu name for an individual item.
      action - A Function that defines the action to be performed on selected items. Return false to quit menu, true to continue in menu.
      itemUpdater - A Function defines how to update the item in items after an action has been performed.

    • formatMoney

      public static String formatMoney(int cents)
      Formats a currency amount in cents to a string representation in dollars and cents.
      Parameters:
      cents - The amount in cents to be formatted.
      Returns:
      The formatted currency string (e.g., "12.34$").

    • quit

      public static void quit()
      Closes the scanner, releasing system resources.

    • validateName

      public static OperationResult validateName(String s) throws RuntimeException
      Validates a name to ensure it contains only letters and optional spaces or hyphens.
      Parameters:
      s - The name to be validated.
      Returns:
      An OperationResult indicating whether the name is valid, along with an error message if invalid.
      Throws:
      RuntimeException - If the validation process encounters an exception.

    • validateEmail

      public static OperationResult validateEmail(String s) throws RuntimeException
      Validates an email address using a regular expression.
      Parameters:
      s - The email address to be validated.
      Returns:
      An OperationResult indicating whether the email address is valid, along with an error message if invalid.
      Throws:
      RuntimeException - If the validation process encounters an exception.

    • validatePhoneNumber

      public static OperationResult validatePhoneNumber(String s) throws RuntimeException
      Validates a phone number using a regular expression that accepts formats xxx xxx xxxx, xxx-xxx-xxxx, and xxxxxxxxxx.

      regex taken from https://www.baeldung.com/java-regex-validate-phone-numbers

      Parameters:
      s - The phone number to be validated.
      Returns:
      An OperationResult indicating whether the phone number is valid, along with an error message if invalid.
      Throws:
      RuntimeException - If the validation process encounters an exception.

    • validateISBN

      public static OperationResult validateISBN(String s) throws RuntimeException
      Validates an ISBN (International Standard Book Number) using a regular expression.
      Parameters:
      s - The ISBN to be validated.
      Returns:
      An OperationResult indicating whether the ISBN is valid, along with an error message if invalid.
      Throws:
      RuntimeException - If the validation process encounters an exception.

    • validateBonusFidelityPoints

      public static OperationResult validateBonusFidelityPoints(int bonusPoints, int price)
      Validates bonus fidelity points based on the provided bonus points and the price of a product.
      Parameters:
      bonusPoints - The bonus points to be validated.
      price - The price of the product.
      Returns:
      An OperationResult indicating whether the bonus points are valid, along with an error message if invalid.

    • validateNumberRange

      public static OperationResult validateNumberRange(int number, int lowerBound, int upperBound)
      Validates a number to ensure it falls within a specified range.
      Parameters:
      number - The number to be validated.
      lowerBound - The lower bound of the valid range.
      upperBound - The upper bound of the valid range.
      Returns:
      An OperationResult indicating whether the number is within the specified range, along with an error message if invalid.

    • validateNotEmpty

      Parameters:

      Returns:
      An OperationResult indicating whether the string is not empty, along with an error message if empty.
